component:ember-notifier/components/embe.title: Close
component:ember-notifier/components/embe.text: The close button component. Inline usage: {{ember-notifier-notification/close close=close}} Block param usage: {{#ember-notifier-notification/close}} <button {{action close}}>Close</button> {{/ember-notifier-notification/close}}

attributes.name: Close
attributes.description:
The close button component.

Inline usage:

{{ember-notifier-notification/close close=close}}

Block param usage:

{{#ember-notifier-notification/close}}
   <button {{action close}}>Close</button>
{{/ember-notifier-notification/close}}

arguments.name: close
arguments.description: Closure action to dismiss the notification.

component:ember-notifier/components/embe.title: EmberNotifierNotification
component:ember-notifier/components/embe.text: The notification component which displays the icon, content, and close button. Inline usage: {{ember-notifier-notification notification=notification close=(action "remove" notification)}} Custom notification components: {{ember-notifier-notification notification=notification close=(action "remove" notification) iconComponent='my-icon-component' contentComponent='my-content-component' closeComponent='my-close-component'}} If the mouse enters the notification and the notification is scheduled to be removed, it will be paused and then restarted when the mouse leaves. If the user swipes right, the notification will be closed.

attributes.name: EmberNotifierNotification
attributes.description:
The notification component which displays the icon, content, and close button.

Inline usage:

{{ember-notifier-notification
  notification=notification
  close=(action "remove" notification)}}

Custom notification components:

{{ember-notifier-notification
  notification=notification
  close=(action "remove" notification)
  iconComponent='my-icon-component'
  contentComponent='my-content-component'
  closeComponent='my-close-component'}}

If the mouse enters the notification and the notification is scheduled to be removed, it will be paused and then restarted when the mouse leaves. If the user swipes right, the notification will be closed.

arguments.name: notification
arguments.description: The notification options object.

arguments.name: close
arguments.description: Closure action to remove the notification.

arguments.name: typeClass
arguments.description: The notification type class name.

arguments.name: animationStateClass
arguments.description: The notification animation state class name.

arguments.name: minSwipeDistance
arguments.description: The number of pixels a user must move before notification will close.

arguments.name: maxSwipeTime
arguments.description: The number of milliseconds a user must move before notification will close.

arguments.name: swipeDirection
arguments.description: The swipe direction, "left" or "right", to close a notification.

arguments.name: iconComponent
arguments.description:
The icon component to render.

Default is: ember-notifier-notification/icon.

arguments.name: contentComponent
arguments.description:
The content component to render.

Default is: ember-notifier-notification/content.

arguments.name: closeComponent
arguments.description:
The close component to render.

Default is: ember-notifier-notification/close.

component:ember-notifier/components/embe.title: Content
component:ember-notifier/components/embe.text: The content component which displays the title and message. Inline usage: {{ember-notifier-notification/content title=notification.title message=notification.message}} Passing an a component name to contentComponent will rendered with the following arguments: {{component contentComponent title=title message=message setOption=setOption}}

attributes.name: Content
attributes.description:
The content component which displays the title and message.

Inline usage:

{{ember-notifier-notification/content
  title=notification.title
  message=notification.message}}

Passing an a component name to contentComponent will rendered with the following arguments:

{{component
  contentComponent
  title=title
  message=message
  setOption=setOption}}

arguments.name: title
arguments.description: Notification title/header.

arguments.name: message
arguments.description: Notification message.

arguments.name: contentComponent
arguments.description: Content component.

arguments.name: setOption
arguments.description: Closure action to change a property on the notification object.

component:ember-notifier/components/embe.title: Icon
component:ember-notifier/components/embe.text: The icon component. Inline usage: {{ember-notifier-notification/icon icon=notification.icon}} Block param usage: {{#ember-notifier-notification/icon}} {{fa-icon notification.icon}} {{/ember-notifier-notification/icon}}

attributes.name: Icon
attributes.description:
The icon component.

Inline usage:

{{ember-notifier-notification/icon icon=notification.icon}}

Block param usage:

{{#ember-notifier-notification/icon}}
   {{fa-icon notification.icon}}
{{/ember-notifier-notification/icon}}

arguments.name: icon
arguments.description: Icon class name or object name.

component:ember-notifier/components/embe.title: EmberNotifier
component:ember-notifier/components/embe.text:
The notification container which positions and displays active notifications. Inline usage: {{ember-notifier position="is-top-right"}} Block param usage: {{#ember-notifier notificationClass='alert' as |notification close|}}
{{notification.title}}

{{notification.message}}

{{/ember-notifier}}

attributes.name: EmberNotifier
attributes.description:
The notification container which positions and displays active notifications.

Inline usage:

{{ember-notifier position="is-top-right"}}

Block param usage:

{{#ember-notifier notificationClass='alert' as |notification close|}}
   <h5>{{notification.title}}</h5>
   <p>{{notification.message}}</p>
   <button {{action close}}>Close</button>
{{/ember-notifier}}

arguments.name: notificationClass
arguments.description: The default class name for notifications.

arguments.name: position='is-top-right'
arguments.description:
The location class name of notifications on the screen.

Supported positions:

  • is-top
  • is-top-left
  • is-top-right
  • is-bottom
  • is-bottom-left
  • is-bottom-right

arguments.name: iconComponent
arguments.description: The default icon component.

arguments.name: contentComponent
arguments.description: The default content component.

arguments.name: closeComponent
arguments.description: The default close component.

yields.name: close
yields.description: Closure action to dismiss the notification.

functions.name: defaultValue
functions.description:
Fallback to a default value if the property is undefined.

Source: github.com/cibernox/ember-power-select

params.name: fallback
params.description: Fallback value if property is undefined.

template:docs/animation.title: Animation
template:docs/animation.text: Animation CSS transitions are used to animate the launching and closing of a notification. Check out animista for various CSS transitions. Customize The following options are supported: showAnimationClass -- The transition class applied when a notification is launched. Defaults to ember-notifier-notification-show. hideAnimationClass -- The transition class applied when a notification is closed. Defaults to ember-notifier-notification-hide. animationTimeout -- The number of milliseconds before a notification is closed. It should equal the CSS animation-delay property value. Defaults to 500. Each option can be set using the global config or when launching a notification. this.get('notifier').primary('Primary notification', { showAnimationClass: 'my-animation-show-class', }); Disable Set showAnimationClass and hideAnimationClass classes to null and animationTimeout to 0.

template:docs/demo.title: Demo
template:docs/demo.text: Demo Notification Icons This demo is using Font Awesome 5 for demonstration purposes.

template:docs/dynamic.title: Dynamic
template:docs/dynamic.text: Dynamic The notification's content can be made dynamic by passing a component name to the contentComponent option. this.get('notifier').info(null, { contentComponent: 'my-component' }); For example: We are going to create a background task using ember-concurrency. Based on the task's result, the notification will be updated using the content component closure action setOption. If the task fails, it will be toggled to is-danger or if successful, is-success. Install ember-concurrency. ember install ember-concurrency Generate the dynamic content component. ember g component task-message

template:docs/icons.title: Icons
template:docs/icons.text: Icons Ember Notifier does not ship with an icon framework. If you are using a web font, you can take advantage of the global config icon class options. For SVG icons, it is recommended to create a custom icon component. Web Font Example using Font Awesome 5 Web Fonts with CSS. Define each global config option icon class. SVG Example using ember-fontawesome. Create an icon component. ember g component notification-icon Define icon names in the global options config. Set notification-icon for iconComponent argument.

template:docs/index.title: Installation
template:docs/index.text: Installation Install the package in your Ember project directory: ember install ember-notifier This addon does not automatically include styling. You must import the addon style yourself. @import "ember-notifier";

template:docs/options.title: Options
template:docs/options.text: Options Notification options can be set globally and overridden when launching. Global In config/environment.js, the service defaults can be overridden using the emberNotifier object: The notification container position can be set to: is-top is-top-left is-top-right is-bottom is-bottom-left is-bottom-right Notification The global config options can be overridden per notification. Extra options such as onRemove() callback function and contentComponent can be included. See ember-notifier.add() for all notification options.

template:docs/styles.title: Styles
template:docs/styles.text: Styles This addon supports customizing the notification style through SASS or using ember-notifier as a block param to apply a framework's component class. SASS To customize the notification, set the addon variables before importing ember-notifier.scss. This approach is powerful enough to build entire themes on top of it. The entire list of available variables can be found in ember-notifier.scss. Frameworks Applying a framework's theme is accomplished by mapping the addon's global config options to the framework's notification classes and using ember-notifier as a block param. Bulma Documentation on Bulma Notifications. Spectre Documentation on Spectre Toasts. Bootstrap Documentation on Bootstrap Alerts. Zurb Foundation Documentation on Zurb Foundation Callouts. Other Do not see your framework? Make a request here.

template:docs/touch.title: Touch
template:docs/touch.text: Touch A notification can be closed by swiping right on a touch device. Customize The following options are supported: swipeDirection -- The horizontal direction the user must swipe. Can be left, right, or null. Defaults to right. minSwipeDistance -- The minimum distance (px) the user must swipe. Defaults to 150. maxSwipeTime -- The maximum amount of time (ms) it must take the user to swipe. Defaults to 300. Each option can be set using the global config or when launching a notification. this.get('notifier').primary('Primary notification', { contentComponent: 'my-large-dynamic-component', minSwipeDistance: '420', }); Disable Set swipeDirection to null to disable closing a notification by a swipe event.

template:docs/usage.title: Usage
template:docs/usage.text: Usage Add the ember-notifier component to your application template. This container displays notifications. Inject the notifier service anywhere you want to launch a notification. import Component from '@ember/component'; import { inject as service } from '@ember/service'; export default Component.extend({ notifier: service(), }); Notifications can be launched by calling styled functions. this.get('notifier').primary('Primary notification'); this.get('notifier').info('Information notification'); this.get('notifier').success('Success notification'); this.get('notifier').warning('Warning notification'); this.get('notifier').danger('Danger notification'); this.get('notifier').secondary('Secondary notification'); Custom notifications can be launched using add(). this.get('notifier').add('Custom notification', { type: 'custom-class' }); All notifications can be closed using empty(). this.get('notifier').empty();

template:index/index-content.text: Looking for the usage? . Features: Uses flexbox and can be easily customized using SASS/SCSS. Does not impose or include any frameworks or icon packages. Easily apply a framework's style like Bootstrap's Alert. Support for dynamic components, for example, a background task preparing a document to download. Inspiration: ember-cli-flash ember-cli-notifications ember-notify ember-notifyme
